snippet: Sri Lanka’s president, Maithripala Sirisena, offered five infantry battalions for United Nations peacekeeping missions.
abstract: Sri Lankan Pres Maithripala Sirisena impresses global leaders at United Nation General Assembly in effort to lift Sri Lanka's stature in world; pledges to contribute to UN peacekeeping efforts and establish war crimes tribunal to address human rights violations stemming from Sri Lanka's civil war.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Sri Lanka’s president, Maithripala Sirisena, offered five infantry battalions for United Nations peacekeeping missions.

headline.main: At U.N. Assembly, Sri Lankan Leader Aims to Lift Country’s Stature
headline.print_headline: At U.N. Assembly, Sri Lankan Leader Aims to Lift Country’s Stature

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
